discoveredAssets: localhost:8082 - Trading Platform Web Application (Apache 2.4.65) - Port 8082, HTTP
http://localhost:8082/ - Login endpoint with hardcoded test credentials (test:test) exposed in HTML comment
http://localhost:8082/password/{username} - Two-step authentication endpoint with user_id exposed in form fields
http://localhost:8082/dashboard - Authenticated dashboard with user personalization and order navigation
http://localhost:8082/orders - Orders management page showing trading history with AJAX receipt loader
http://localhost:8082/order/{orderId}/receipt - AJAX API endpoint returning order receipt data (VULNERABLE TO IDOR)
http://localhost:8082/logout - POST-only logout endpoint for session termination
/static/js/jquery-3.5.1.min.js - jQuery library for AJAX and DOM manipulation

targets.objective: Test authentication system for: (1) SQL injection/NoSQL injection in username and password fields, (2) Weak credential validation, (3) User enumeration via error messages in /password/{username} endpoint, (4) Session fixation and management flaws, (5) Two-step authentication bypass, (6) Default credentials (test:test) effectiveness
targets.rationale: Test credentials are hardcoded and exposed in HTML comments, authentication uses two-step process with hidden user_id field. Need to verify if authentication can be bypassed or credentials manipulated.

targets.objective: Test Insecure Direct Object Reference (IDOR): (1) Access other users' orders by changing orderId parameter (test with ranges like 300000-301000), (2) Verify authorization checks between user_id and order_id, (3) Test for horizontal privilege escalation to access all order receipts, (4) Check for any account-level authorization bypass, (5) Test POST/PUT/DELETE methods on receipts
targets.rationale: CONFIRMED IDOR VULNERABILITY: Successfully accessed order 300214 while logged in as test user (ID 10032). This indicates no user-based authorization on order endpoints, allowing horizontal privilege escalation to view any user's orders.

targets.objective: Test order system for: (1) IDOR in order list retrieval, (2) Business logic flaws in order display and quantity calculations, (3) XSS in order data rendering (ticker, quantity, price fields), (4) CSRF protection on order modifications, (5) Race conditions in order processing
targets.rationale: Orders page displays financial/trading data with order IDs that are sequential numeric values. Need to verify if attacker can manipulate other users' orders or access unauthorized trading data.

targets.objective: Test for: (1) User enumeration by testing different usernames and checking error messages, (2) Information disclosure via error messages (reveals user exists/doesn't exist, displays personalization 'Welcome, John!'), (3) User ID leakage in hidden form fields (user_id=10032), (4) Password reset or account recovery vulnerabilities, (5) Bypass of two-step authentication process
targets.rationale: Endpoint exposes user information and user_id in form fields. Different error messages for valid/invalid users enable account enumeration. Need to identify all existing users and their IDs for exploitation.

targets.objective: Test for: (1) Session management flaws (token reuse, predictable tokens, lack of HTTPS), (2) Privilege escalation from regular user to admin, (3) CSRF protection on logout and other actions, (4) Session fixation attacks, (5) Concurrent session handling
targets.rationale: Authenticated endpoint showing personalized data. Need to verify session security and confirm no privilege escalation opportunities from test account to admin functions.

targets.objective: Test for: (1) Common web vulnerabilities: XSS, CSRF, injection attacks, path traversal, (2) Security headers (X-Frame-Options, CSP, HSTS, X-XSS-Protection), (3) Information disclosure (error messages, stack traces, comments), (4) File upload vulnerabilities if available, (5) API security and rate limiting
targets.rationale: Application reveals sensitive information in HTML comments. Need comprehensive security assessment to identify all attack vectors and misconfigurations across the application.

keyFindings: [CRITICAL] Hardcoded test credentials exposed in HTML comment on login page: test:test - allows unauthorized access to application

[CRITICAL] Insecure Direct Object Reference (IDOR) vulnerability in /order/{orderId}/receipt endpoint - authenticated test user can access other users' order receipts by changing orderId parameter (confirmed by accessing order 300214)
[CRITICAL] User ID exposure in HTML hidden form fields at /password/{username} endpoint (user_id=10032) - enables user enumeration and account targeting
[HIGH] User enumeration vulnerability via error messages at /password/{username} endpoint - different error messages reveal whether usernames exist
[HIGH] Personalization data leakage - endpoint displays 'Welcome, John!' revealing user names
[HIGH] Two-step authentication with hidden user_id parameter - improper design exposes user identifiers in client-side form fields
[MEDIUM] Sequential numeric order IDs (300123, 300214, 300327, 300481) - predictable and enable easy enumeration of all orders in system
[MEDIUM] No apparent CSRF token validation visible on form submissions
[LOW] Static assets (jQuery, Bootstrap) are accessible but are standard libraries with known versions
